text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.text: Subscribing to a lot of RSS feeds can start to feel like

link.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: . It doesn’t take long to build up a huge list of

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: feeds. Fortunately, RSS Bandit provides rich searching capabilities.
RSS Bandit has two search facilities built in:
and local search. Local Search searches the contents of all your downloaded items and returns the results within a folder underneath the folder named

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: button in the toolbar (see Figure 1) will bring up the search window (see Figure 2). This is a collapsible window so it can be collapsed within RSS Bandit to provide more detail display screen area. The window contains a textbox for entering the search phrase, a button to initiate the search, and several search options within collapsible panes below.
By default, entering text into the textbox and clicking

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: will perform a simple text search within the Description, and Title (if posts does not provide content) elements of every RSS Item.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Bandit version 1.5.*, RSS Bandit now makes use of the

link.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: search engine, a direct port of the

link.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: This gives you a powerful syntax for searching. For example, the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

image.title: Figure 3: Example of a fuzzy search.

para.text: Figure 3: Example of a fuzzy search.
Although I misspelled “Mississippi”, it was able to find posts with the correct spelling via the fuzzy search syntax (the tilde character ~)
To learn more about the search query syntax,

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: Figure 4 shows the fields that are available for searching using checkboxes:

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

li.text: - Typically this is the content of the feed item that you see in the aggregator's reading pane.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: There are more searchable fields available. Read about them in

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: The Advanced Fields option shown in figure 5 provides several options for tuning search results.
To enable an advanced option, click on the button beside the option name and the red bar will be converted to a green check mark.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: - enabling this option allows you to filter posts by their read status. If you enable the Read Status option and check the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: checkbox only unread items will be returned in the search. If the checkbox is unchecked then only read posts are returned. When this feature is disabled, both read and unread posts are returned in search results.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:16px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8px; line-height:1.0; background-color:#ffffcc; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; padding:7px; border-color:#999999; border-style:single; border-width:1px; tabstops:none;
para.text: You can not define a search with Read Status specified only for internal technical reasons! To get only unread items, please use the new special folder named

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: There are three mutually exclusive ways to filter search results based on the date of the items.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

li.text: - enabling this option lets you filter search results by the age of the feed item. The age is determined by the date when the item was downloaded into RSS Bandit. For example, you can check

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

li.text: in the dropdown to limit search results to feed items that were downloaded over two hours ago. Likewise, selecting

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

li.text: will limit search results to items that are less than a day old.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

li.text: - enabling this option lets you filter items by the date they were posted. The post date is determined by the date the item was posted to the server as indicated by the RSS (or ATOM) feed. RSS indicates this via the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

li.text: element. The dropdown gives you the option to filter posts at, before, or after the date selected in the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

li.text: - enabling this option filters items based on a date range. This is similar to the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: The scope for a search can be narrowed to a selection of categories or even individual feeds. Figure 8 shows the Search Scope option. It contains a tree view with a checkbox next to each category and feed. By selecting and unselecting feeds and categories, you can narrow or expand the scope of your search.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: you’ve selected your results, click on

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: to get your results. The search results will be shown in the Feed Details section as well as the Reader Pane as in Figure 7.
Figure 7 shows the results of an

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: , which found all the posts in which the author’s name is

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-style:italic; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
